Meetings with group organizers.
Two of these were held during the course of the experiment to clarify the
reactions on the weekly report form, to establish areas of agreement among the
groups regarding the Experiment, and to develop additional information beyond that
recorded on the weekly reports.
Observation..
Ten groups were visited two or more times during the cnurse of the experiment
by competent observers who were specially briefed for this task. Their reports have
been previously summarized.
A final meeting at the conclusion of the series.
This meeting, held after the middb of June, was attended by about 200 people
who had participated in groups or had heard the program on the air. The albums of
recordings of the ’’Ways of Mankind” series were distributed to the groups that had
won them. A remarkable degree of enthusiasm was exhibited in this final meeting.
Buzz groups were formed to obtain general reactions to the Experiment as a whole.
There were repeated calls for a new series of programs at a later time.
REACTIONS TO THE TOTaL EXPERIMENT
From the long list of varied reactions to the Experiment, these stand out as
characteristic of the feelings ofmost of the people who participated;
1. They regarded the entire Experiment as a very successful undertaking and
requested similar programs in near future.
2. a greatly increased understanding of American society in all its complexi¬
ties was reported by practically all participants.
